Subroutine waterbalance

  1 :       subroutine waterbalance(init)
  2 : !***********************************************************************
  3 : !*  Layered water balance
  4 : !*----------------------------------------------------------------------
  5 : !*  Author: Stan Schymanski, Max Planck Institute for Biogeochemistry
  6 : !*  Email: sschym@bgc-jena.mpg.de
  7 : !*  06/2008
  8 : !*  Version: REW with layered unsaturated zone, no routing
  9 : !*----------------------------------------------------------------------
 10 : !*
 11 : !* Numbers in the commented parentheses refer to the equation numeration
 12 : !* in the document 'equations.pdf' that comes with the documentation.
 13 : !*
 14 : !*----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15 : !*
 16 : !* This subroutine ('waterbalance') uses the variables defined in  
 17 : !* modules.f90, some of which have to be allocated prior to calling  
 18 : !* 'waterbalance'.
 19 : !* When calling the 'waterbalance', the 'init' variable must be given 
 20 : !* (1 to generate initial conditions, otherwise 0).
 21 : !* This subroutine calculates the water balance for a time step <=dtmax.
 22 : !* The calling program must transfer the new variables ('new' in their names)
 23 : !* to the old variables for the next time step, before calling 'waterbalance'
 24 : !* again. Example: call waterbalance(init) , time=time+dt, ys=ysnew...
 25 : !*
 26 : !*----------------------------------------------------------------------
 27 : !*  Copyright (C) 2008  Stan Schymanski
 28 : !*
 29 : !*    This program is free software: you can redistribute it and/or modify
 30 : !*    it under the terms of the GNU General Public License as published by
 31 : !*    the Free Software Foundation, either version 3 of the License, or
 32 : !*    (at your option) any later version.
 33 : !*
 34 : !*    This program is distributed in the hope that it will be useful,
 35 : !*    but WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of
 36 : !*    MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.  See the
 37 : !*    GNU General Public License for more details.
 38 : !*
 39 : !*    You should have received a copy of the GNU General Public License
 40 : !*    along with this program. If not, see http://www.gnu.org/licenses.
 41 : !*
 42 : !***********************************************************************
 43 : 
 44 :       use watmod
 45 :       use vegwatmod
 46 :       implicit none
 47 : 
 48 :       INTEGER, INTENT(in) :: init
 49 : 
 50 :       REAL*8  :: dummy
 51 :       LOGICAL :: isnand
 52 :       LOGICAL :: isinfd
 53 :       REAL*8  :: dtsu
 54 :       REAL*8  :: wc_
 55 :       REAL*8  :: wcnew
 56 :       INTEGER :: i, j
 57 : 
 58 : !     * INITIALISATION
 59 : 
 60 : !     * Run initial run
 61 :       if (init .eq. 1) then
 62 :         dtsu_count = 0
 63 :         dtmax_count = 0
 64 :         ys_ = cz
 65 :         nlayers_ = 0
 66 : !       * Adapt the number of unsaturated layers such that ys = zr
 67 :         do while (ys_ .gt. zr_)
 68 :           nlayers_ = nlayers_ + 1
 69 :           ys_ = ys_ - delzvec(nlayers_)
 70 :         enddo
 71 :         pcapvec(nlayers_+1:M___) = 0.d0
 72 : !       * Equilibrium pressure head
 73 :         do j = nlayers_, 1, -1
 74 :           pcapvec(j) = 0.5d0 * delzvec(j+1) + 0.5d0 * delzvec(j) + pcapvec(j+1)
 75 :         enddo
 76 : !       * equilibrium su above a saturated layer (after eq_sueq1 in Watbal3)
 77 :         do j = 1, M___ - 1
 78 :           sueqvec(j) = (1.d0 / ((0.5d0 * (delzvec(j+1) +  delzvec(j))  &
 79 :      &               * avgvec(j)) ** nvgvec(j) + 1.d0)) ** mvgvec(j)
 80 :         enddo
 81 :         sueqvec(M___) = (1.d0 / ((0.5d0 * delzvec(j) * avgvec(j))      &
 82 :      &                ** nvgvec(j) + 1.d0)) ** mvgvec(j)
 83 :         suvec_(:) = (1.d0 / ((pcapvec(:) * avgvec(:)) ** nvgvec(:)     &
 84 :      &            + 1.d0)) ** mvgvec(:)
 85 : !       * unsat. hydrol. cond. as a function of su
 86 :         kunsatvec(:) = ((-suvec_(:) ** (1.d0 / mvgvec(:)) + 1.d0)      &
 87 :      &               ** mvgvec(:) - 1.d0) ** 2.d0 * ksatvec(:)         &
 88 :      &               * SQRT(suvec_(:))
 89 :         cH2Ol_s(:) = (-suvec_(:) * thetarvec(:) + suvec_(:)            &
 90 :      &             * thetasvec(:) + thetarvec(:)) * delzvec(:)
 91 : 
 92 :         ysnew        = ys_
 93 :         nlayersnew   = nlayers_
 94 :         pcapnewvec   = pcapvec
 95 :         sunewvec     = suvec_
 96 :         kunsatnewvec = kunsatvec
 97 : !        omgu_        = 1.d0                  ! In this version, the hill slope is vertical, thus there is no saturated surface fraction
 98 : !        omgunew      = omgu_
 99 : 
100 :         return
101 :       endif
102 : 
103 : !     * CURRENT SOIL WATER CONTENT
104 : 
105 :       cH2Ol_s(:) = (-suvec_(:) * thetarvec(:) + suvec_(:)             &
106 :      &           * thetasvec(:) + thetarvec(:)) * delzvec(:)
107 :       wc_ = SUM(cH2Ol_s)
108 : 
109 : !     * FLUXES
110 : 
111 :       if (rain_ .gt. 0.d0) then
112 :         if (nlayers_ .ge. 1) then
113 :           inf_ = MIN((ksatvec(1) + kunsatvec(1)) / 2.d0 *(1.d0        &
114 :      &         + (2.d0 * pcapvec(1)) / delzvec(1)), rain_)  ! (3.6), (Out[60])
115 :         else
116 :           inf_ = 0.d0
117 :         endif
118 :         infx__ = rain_ - inf_
119 :       else 
120 :         inf_ = 0.d0
121 :         infx__ = 0.d0
122 :       endif
123 : 
124 :       qblvec(:) = 0.d0
125 :       if (nlayers_ .gt. 1) then
126 : !       * Runoff occurs only from the layer 'nlayers_',
127 : !         therefore no downward flow into the layers below is allowed.
128 :         do j = 1, nlayers_ - 1
129 :           qblvec(j) = -0.5d0 * (2.d0 * (pcapvec(j+1) - pcapvec(j))     &
130 :      &              / (delzvec(j+1) + delzvec(j)) + 1.d0)              &
131 :      &              * (kunsatvec(j+1) + kunsatvec(j))
132 :         enddo
133 :       endif
134 : 
135 :       esoil__  = 0.0002d0 * (1.d0 - 0.8d0 * (pc_ + pcg_(2))) * par_ * suvec_(1)
136 : !     * Seepage face flow as a function of ys_ following eq_spgfcf in Watbal3.
137 :       spgfcf__ = 0.d0
138 :       if (ys_ .gt. zr_) then
139 :         spgfcf__ = MAX(0.d0, 0.5d0 * (sqrt(cz - zr_) - sqrt(cz - ys_))  &
140 :      &           * (ys_ - zr_) * ksatvec(nlayers_) / (sqrt(cz - zr_)    &
141 :      &           * cgs * Cos(go_)))
142 :       endif
143 : 
144 : !     * MAKING SURE THAT NO SUBLAYER 'OVERFLOWS'
145 : 
146 :       if (MAXVAL(suvec_(1:nlayers_)) .ge. 1.d0) then
147 : 
148 :         if (nlayers_ .gt. 1) then
149 :           if (suvec_(1) .ge. 0.99d0) then
150 :             dummy = esoil__ - inf_ + ruptkvec(1) + ruptkg(1)
151 :             if (qblvec(1) - dummy .gt. 0.d0) then
152 :               qblvec(1) = dummy - 1.d-16              ! (Out[156])+ruptkg(1)
153 :             endif
154 :           endif
155 :         endif
156 : 
157 :         if (nlayers_ .gt. 2) then
158 :           do i = 2, nlayers_ - 1
159 :             if (suvec_(i) .ge. 0.99d0) then
160 :               dummy = qblvec(i-1) + ruptkvec(i) + ruptkg(i)     ! 1.d-16 makes sure that 0 does not get transformed to tiny positive
161 :               if (qblvec(i) - dummy .gt. 0.d0) then
162 :                 qblvec(i) = dummy - 1.d-16          ! (Out[158])+ruptkg(i)
163 :               endif
164 :             endif
165 :           enddo
166 :         endif
167 : 
168 :         if (nlayers_ .gt. 1) then
169 :           if (suvec_(nlayers_) .ge. 1.d0) then
170 :             dummy = -qblvec(nlayers_-1) - ruptkvec(nlayers_) - ruptkg(nlayers_) 
171 : !           * make sure that any surplus water runs off
172 :             spgfcf__ = max(spgfcf__, dummy + 1.d-16)
173 :           endif
174 :         else
175 :           if (suvec_(nlayers_) .ge. 1.d0) then
176 :             dummy = inf_ - esoil__ - ruptkvec(1) - ruptkg(1)
177 :             spgfcf__ = max(spgfcf__, dummy + 1.d-16)
178 :           endif
179 :         endif
180 : 
181 :       endif
182 : 
183 : !     * CHANGES IN SOIL MOISTURE IN THE UNSATURATED ZONE
184 : 
185 :       io_      = inf_ - esoil__ - spgfcf__ - SUM(ruptkvec(:)) - SUM(ruptkg(:))  ! (3.19)
186 :       iovec(:) = 0.d0
187 :       iovec(1) = qblvec(1) + inf_ - esoil__ - ruptkvec(1) - ruptkg(1)
188 :       if (nlayers_ .eq. 1) then
189 :         iovec(1) = iovec(1) - spgfcf__
190 :       endif
191 :       if (nlayers_ .gt. 2) then
192 :         do j = 2, nlayers_ - 1     
193 :           iovec(j) = qblvec(j) - qblvec(j-1) - ruptkvec(j) - ruptkg(j)
194 :         enddo
195 :       endif
196 :       if (nlayers_ .gt. 1) then
197 :         iovec(nlayers_) = qblvec(nlayers_) - qblvec(nlayers_-1)        &
198 :      &                  - ruptkvec(nlayers_) - ruptkg(nlayers_) - spgfcf__
199 :       endif
200 : 
201 :       dsuvec(:) = -iovec(:) / ((thetarvec(:) - thetasvec(:)) * delzvec(:))
202 : 
203 : !     * CALCULATION OF MAXIMAL TIME STEP SIZE
204 : 
205 :       dtsu = 999999.d0
206 :       do j = 1, nlayers_
207 :         if (dsuvec(j) .lt. 0.d0) then
208 :           dtsu = MIN(dtsu, -0.1d0 * suvec_(j) / dsuvec(j))
209 :         endif
210 :         if (dsuvec(j) .gt. 0.d0) then
211 :           dtsu = MIN(dtsu, 0.1d0 * suvec_(j) / dsuvec(j),              &
212 :      &              (1.d0 - suvec_(j)) / dsuvec(j))
213 :         endif
214 :       enddo
215 : 
216 : !!$!* for debugging in pgf90:
217 : !!$    if (isnand(dsuvec(i))) then
218 : !!$     print *, "Its a NaN"
219 : !!$    elseif (isinfd(dsuvec(i))) then
220 : !!$     print *, "Its a Inf" 
221 : !!$    endif
222 : 
223 : !     * LENGTH OF TIME STEP
224 : 
225 :       dt_ = MAX(0.d0, MIN(dtsu, dtmax))
226 :       if(dt_.eq.dtsu) then
227 :         dtsu_count = dtsu_count + 1
228 :       elseif(dt_.eq.dtmax) then
229 :         dtmax_count = dtmax_count + 1
230 :       endif
231 : 
232 : !*----- Calculating state variables at next time step-------------------
233 : 
234 :       sunewvec(:) = suvec_(:) + dt_ * dsuvec(:)
235 :       j = M___
236 :       nlayersnew = M___
237 : !     * Find the lowest unsaturated layer and set the one below it as nlayersnew
238 :       do while (sunewvec(j) .gt. 0.999999d0 .and. j .gt. 1)
239 :         j = j - 1
240 :         nlayersnew = j  
241 :       enddo
242 : !     * If there is not enough moisture in the layer above the saturated
243 : !       layers, the water table is in the top saturated layer.
244 :       if (sunewvec(nlayersnew) .lt. sueqvec(nlayersnew)) then
245 :         nlayersnew = nlayersnew + 1
246 :       endif
247 :       sunewvec(nlayersnew + 1:M___) = 1.d0
248 :       pcapnewvec(:) = 1.d0 / avgvec(:) * (sunewvec(:) ** (-1.d0        &
249 :      &              / mvgvec(:)) - 1.d0) ** (1.d0 / nvgvec(:))
250 : 
251 :       kunsatnewvec(:) = ksatvec(:) * ((-sunewvec(:) ** (1.d0           &
252 :      &                / mvgvec(:)) + 1.d0) ** mvgvec(:) - 1.d0)        &
253 :      &                ** 2.d0 * SQRT(sunewvec(:))
254 : !    Position of the water table after eq_wt1 in watbal3:
255 :       if (nlayersnew .lt. M___) then
256 :         ysnew = SUM(delzvec(nlayersnew:M___)) - 2.d0                   &
257 :      &        * delzvec(nlayersnew) * pcapnewvec(nlayersnew)           &
258 :      &        / (delzvec(nlayersnew+1) + delzvec(nlayersnew))
259 :       else
260 :         ysnew = delzvec(nlayersnew) - 2.d0 * delzvec(nlayersnew)       &
261 :      &        * pcapnewvec(nlayersnew) / delzvec(nlayersnew)
262 :       endif
263 : 
264 :       cH2Ol_s(:) = (-sunewvec(:) * thetarvec(:) + sunewvec(:)          &
265 :      &           * thetasvec(:) + thetarvec(:)) * delzvec(:)
266 : 
267 : !!$  ! For debugging in pgf90: 
268 : !!$   do i=1,nlayers
269 : !!$    if (isnand(sunewvec(i))) then
270 : !!$     print *, "Its a NaN"
271 : !!$    elseif (isinfd(sunewvec(i))) then
272 : !!$     print *, "Its a Inf" 
273 : !!$    endif
274 : !!$    enddo
275 : 
276 : !     * CHECK WATER BALANCE
277 : 
278 :       wcnew = SUM(cH2Ol_s(:))
279 : 
280 : !!$ print*,"errorstep=",(wc+dt*io-wcnew)
281 : 
282 :       if (ABS(wc_ + dt_ * io_ - wcnew) .gt. 1.d-6) then
283 :         print *, "error=", (wc_ + dt_ * io_ - wcnew), " ys=", ysnew
284 :         print *, "sum(iovec) = ", SUM(iovec(:)), "; io = ", io_
285 :         print *, "day = ", d___, "; hour = ", h__
286 :       endif
287 : 
288 :       return
289 :       end subroutine waterbalance
